item.title: Report I-2024060039
item.description:
Report I-2024060039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T00:38:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: STOCKBRIDGE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 60125
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: TOTE LOADED ONTO TRAILER ALONG WITH OTHER FREIGHT FOR TRANSPORT. FREIGHT SHIFTED AND WAS PUNCTURED BY A FORKLIFT BLADE BEING SHIPPED. THE PUNCTURE WAS APPROXIMATE 3 INCHES WIDE AND 1 INCH THICK. HAZMAT 1 CONTACTED FOR REMEDIATION AS WELL AS EMERGENCY SERVICES INCLUDING EPA.

item.title: Report E-2024070748
item.description:
Report E-2024070748

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-18
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon jug of corrosive liquid was punctured and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel utilized absorbents and cleaners to remediate the site. All waste was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070681
item.description:
Report E-2024070681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-01
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of Standard Performance Topcoat CatÂ® Yellow released from (1) 10-gallon metal drum due to freight falling on it during transit. The release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with the available PPE onsite.
